meanings.definition: To utter with a particular tone or modulation of voice.
meanings.sent1: She was intonating her words to sound more cheerful.
meanings.sent2: The teacher intonated the story to make it more engaging for the students.
meanings.sent3: The robot started intonating jokes in a robotic voice.
meanings.sent4: Her intonating voice painted a picture of sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The intonating melody of the song stayed with me long after it ended.

meanings.definition: To sing or recite with musical intonation.
meanings.sent1: The choir intonated the hymn beautifully.
meanings.sent2: She intonated the poem with a melodic voice.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to be intonating along with the music.
meanings.sent4: Her intonating voice was like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The intonating notes of the piano filled the room with warmth.

meanings.definition: To give tone or variety of tone to.
meanings.sent1: He intonated his speech to convey authority.
meanings.sent2: The actor intonated his lines with emotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat intonated its meows in different pitches.
meanings.sent4: Her intonating laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The intonating colors of the painting brought it to life.
